docs.lead_paragraph: There is new evidence that breast-feeding is associated with a lower incidence of breast cancer among younger women with breast cancer in the family.

headline.seo: Breast-Feeding May Lower Breast Cancer Risk for Some
headline.main: Breast-Feeding Linked to Lower Cancer Risk
headline.print_headline: Breast-Feeding Linked to Lower Cancer Risk

docs.snippet: There is new evidence that breast-feeding is associated with a lower incidence of breast cancer among younger women with breast cancer in the family.

docs.lead_paragraph: The United States under President Obama may no longer be fighting a "global war on terror," as his counterterrorism and homeland security adviser John Brennan announced in a major speech last week.

headline.main: Weighing Cost and Conscience in Afghanistan

docs.abstract: The U.S. is escalating its forces. But isn't it time to claim "mission accomplished"?
docs.snippet: The U.S. is escalating its forces. But isn't it time to claim "mission accomplished"?

docs.lead_paragraph: Earlier this week, Room for Debate ran a discussion about prescription drug ads asking whether if they should or should not be reined in as some in Congress have suggested. Of the more than 300 comments the forum generated, it's official: the overwhelming majority would like to see these ads altered or banned altogether. Below are excerpts of some of those comments.
docs.abstract: Readers would like to see direct-to-consumer drug advertising reined in or banned altogether.
docs.snippet: Readers would like to see direct-to-consumer drug advertising reined in or banned altogether.
